cyber_attacks.name: Phishing
cyber_attacks.definition: An attack where attackers impersonate a legitimate entity to trick users into providing sensitive information, often through deceptive emails or messages.

laws_in_india.sections: Section 66C - Identity Theft, Section 66D - Cheating by Personation
Section 419 - Punishment for Cheating by Personation, Section 420 - Cheating and Dishonestly Inducing Delivery of Property

solution.awareness_training: Educate employees and users on identifying phishing emails, such as checking sender addresses and avoiding suspicious links.
solution.email_security: Use email filters and spam protection tools to reduce phishing attempts.
solution.multi_factor_authentication: Implement multi-factor authentication (MFA) to protect against unauthorized access.

cyber_attacks.name: Malware Attack
cyber_attacks.definition: A form of attack that involves malicious software like viruses, worms, trojans, or spyware, aimed at disrupting or gaining unauthorized access to systems.

laws_in_india.sections: Section 43 - Penalty for Damage to Computer, Section 66 - Computer-Related Offences

solution.antivirus_software: Install and update antivirus or anti-malware software regularly to protect against known threats.
solution.software_updates: Regularly update all system software to patch vulnerabilities and reduce malware risks.
solution.safe_browsing_practices: Avoid downloading or opening attachments from unknown sources and use trusted applications only.

cyber_attacks.name: Ransomware Attack
cyber_attacks.definition: A type of malware that encrypts the victim's files and demands a ransom payment for decryption.

laws_in_india.sections: Section 66 - Computer-Related Offences, Section 66E - Punishment for Violation of Privacy

solution.data_backup: Regularly back up critical data and ensure it is stored securely and offline.
solution.endpoint_protection: Use endpoint protection and monitoring tools to detect ransomware threats early.
solution.user_training: Train users to avoid clicking on unverified links or downloading suspicious attachments.

cyber_attacks.name: Denial of Service (DoS) Attack
cyber_attacks.definition: An attack that attempts to make a machine or network resource unavailable to its intended users by overwhelming it with traffic.

solution.anti_ddos_services: Use anti-DDoS services to detect and mitigate denial-of-service attacks.
solution.firewalls_and_rate_limiting: Set up firewalls and implement rate limiting to manage traffic surges.
solution.traffic_monitoring: Monitor network traffic for unusual activity and set up alerts for potential attacks.

cyber_attacks.name: SQL Injection
cyber_attacks.definition: An attack where malicious SQL statements are inserted into a database query, potentially allowing attackers unauthorized access to data.

solution.parameterized_queries: Use parameterized queries or prepared statements to prevent SQL injection vulnerabilities.
solution.code_review: Perform regular code reviews and audits to ensure secure database interaction.
solution.web_application_firewalls: Deploy web application firewalls (WAF) to filter and monitor SQL injection attempts.

cyber_attacks.name: Man-in-the-Middle (MitM) Attack
cyber_attacks.definition: An attack where an attacker secretly intercepts and relays messages between two parties, who believe they are directly communicating.

laws_in_india.sections: Section 379 - Theft, Section 403 - Dishonest Misappropriation of Property

solution.encryption_protocols: Use strong encryption protocols such as HTTPS and SSL/TLS to secure communications.
solution.authentication_methods: Implement secure authentication methods like two-factor authentication.
solution.public_wifi_warning: Advise users to avoid conducting sensitive transactions over public Wi-Fi.

cyber_attacks.name: Password Attack
cyber_attacks.definition: An attack involving methods such as brute force, credential stuffing, or dictionary attacks to obtain passwords for unauthorized access.

laws_in_india.sections: Section 420 - Cheating and Dishonestly Inducing Delivery of Property

solution.strong_password_policy: Implement a strong password policy, requiring complex and unique passwords.
solution.multi_factor_authentication: Use multi-factor authentication to add an extra layer of security.
solution.password_manager: Encourage the use of password managers to store and manage complex passwords securely.

cyber_attacks.name: Social Engineering Attack
cyber_attacks.definition: An attack that exploits human psychology to deceive individuals into providing confidential information or access to systems.

solution.employee_training: Conduct regular training for employees on recognizing social engineering tactics.
solution.verification_process: Implement strict identity verification processes for sensitive information requests.
solution.security_policies: Develop and enforce security policies for handling sensitive data and communications.

cyber_attacks.name: Zero-Day Exploit
cyber_attacks.definition: An attack that takes advantage of a software vulnerability before it is known to the software vendor and before a patch is available.

solution.threat_intelligence: Use threat intelligence services to stay informed of new vulnerabilities and potential zero-day exploits.
solution.patch_management: Regularly update software and implement a robust patch management strategy.
solution.intrusion_detection_system: Deploy intrusion detection systems to monitor for unusual activity and detect potential exploits.
